page.title: 09PRISTON VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Closure of the village school (16 years ago), the Post office and shop (10 years ago) has affected village life. Villagers miss the gathering of parents outside the school gates and the meeting of other people from different villages/hamlets who used the Post Office/shop. Children now travel to Markesbury and Farmborough for schooling. A bus is provided for those children who go to Markesbury, but those attending Farmborough school travel by private car. A few children go to private schools. The school building has become the village hall and is used for several major events. Monthly "Ladies Evening" are held there as well as Country Dancing and Morris Dancing.
